exm.mng: already, since, both... (and...)
since, as, this being the case
is both ...(and...), since, as, being the case that
just as in the past (idiom); as before, continuing as always
vested in, already obtained, vesting
vested interest
existing

Since they have come, we should make them comfortable (idiom). Since we're here, take it easy., Since this is so, we should accept it., Now we have come, let's stay and take the rough with the smooth., If you can't do anything to prevent it, you might as well sit back and enjoy it.
exm.pyn: jì lái zhī , zé ān zhī

exm.mng: déjà vu
fait accompli
to forget and not bear recriminations (idiom); to let bygones be bygones, There is no point in crying over spilt milk.
lit. once said, a team of horses cannot unsay it (idiom); a promise must be kept
exm.pyn: yī yán jì chū , sì mǎ nán zhuī

exm.mng: not censure sb for his past misdeeds, overlook sb's past mistakes, let bygones be bygones
vesting period (in finance)
lit. once said, a team of horses cannot unsay it (idiom); a promise must be kept
exm.pyn: yī yán jì chū , sì mǎ nán zhuī

past, bygone, the past
